citation.article-title: Eionea nigra gen. nov., sp. nov., a gammaproteobacterium from the Mediterranean Sea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Eionea nigra sp. nov.
Eionea nigra (ni′gra. L. adj. nigra black, referring to the colour of the colonies of the type strain).
Forms dark-grey colonies on MA medium.
Cells are motile Gram-negative rods, 1.4±0.1×0.5±0.5 µm, with a single polar flagellum.
Growth occurs at 10–44 °C (optimum 30 °C), at pH 5–9 (optimum pH 8) and in 7–70 g NaCl l−1 (optimum 35 g l−1).
Positive reactions with Biolog GN2 plates were obtained for d-glucose, d-mannitol, citrate and l-proline.
In API ZYM tests, alkaline phosphatase acitivity is positive and esterase (C4) and naphthol-AS-B1-phosphohydrolase activities are weakly positive.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C18 : 0 and C10 : 0 3-OH.
The type strain, 17X/A02/237T ( = DSM 19752T = CIP 109759T = MOLA 288T), was isolated from a water column in the bay of Banyuls-sur-Mer (42° 29′ N 3° 08′ E).
The DNA G+C content of strain 17X/A02/237T is 47.5 mol%.
